comments:
Nomatter if downloaded or compiled (using: USE="-gnome gtk" emerge eclipse-sdk")
Eclipse-sdk does not start at all. The splash appears and thats it. The next 
message tell you to look in the ~/workspace/.metadata/.log which tells you this:

Where could be the problem?
Sorry if bothering you but there is no solution to this available neither in the 
gentoo-forums nor here in another bug-report.

If anything else is needed please let me know.

Is your home directory mounted noexec?

Eclipse has extracted a shared library into your home directory and is trying to load it.

Yes it was :-) (Not verified yet, because a revdep-rebuild for gnome is currently running ;-))
Could this also be the problem when using the emerged version of eclipse, 
as this version also "installs"/copies swt-libs to the users home-dir?

BTW: you know a way to only mount the homes exec for dedicated users?

Solved the problem!
It now runs as smoothly as intended to.

thx a lot
But has got nothing to to with eclipse.
